ids.description:
Filter the collection based on the event id or group of ids. Provide a comma-separated list of ID strings.
The ID strings must be url encoded.

classification.description: Filter based on the application classification

vendor.description: Filter based on the vendor platform.

detected_at_after.description: Specify a timestamp. Filter for applications detected after a given date.

detected_at_before.description: Specify a timestamp. Filter for applications detected before a given date.

app_ids.description: Filter for applications based on their id. Provide a comma-delimited string of IDs.

scope_categories.description: Filter for applications based on their scope category. Provide a comma-delimited string of scope category.

install_state.description: Filter for applications based on their state (installed or not installed).

count_total.description:
Determines whether the `total` field returns a valid count of the applications.
Use the `count_total` value with the `offset` parameter to paginate the results.
Default value is `false`. Set to `true` to return a valid apps count.

platform.description: The application supplying the underlying data.

owners.description: comma delimited list of owner email addresses

asset_type.description:
google_document, google_spreadsheet, google_presentation, google_form,
google_drawing, google_site, google_plus_post (future),
google_non_native_file, pdf, folder

updated_before.description: Filters assets updated before the specified timestamp.

updated_after.description: Filters assets updated after the specified timestamp.

id.description: The ID of the entity in the incident.

incident_type.description: Filter based on the incident type.

severity.description: Filter based on the incident severity.

policy_id.description: Filter based on the policy ID.

updated_before.description: Filter based on incidents updated before a given date.

updated_after.description: Filter based on incidents updated after a given date.

incident_status.description: Filter based on the incident status.

vendor.description: Filter based on the platform (for example: google, salesforce)

customer_key.description: Filter based on the customer_key field.

fields.description:
Return only the selected parent fields. For example: id and entity fields.
Provide a comma-delimited list of parent fields.

order.description: Sort by the date when the incident was created (A dash (`-`) denotes descending order).

flat.description: If set to `true`, flatten the output to simplify ingestion of data by tabular systems.

vendor.description: Filter based on the platform (for example: google, salesforce)

order.description: Order based on the severity. Only descending severity is supported.

name: listIncidentAggregatesUsers
description: List Status and Users for Incident Aggregates

ids.description: List of entry IDs to delete.

q.description: Match string within any of: name, location, ip_address, categories

name.description: Match a substring within entry name

id.description: The ID of the entry to update.

ids.description: A comma-delimited string of IDs to delete.

q.description: Match string within any of: name, location, ip_address, categories.

name.description: Match a substring within entry name.

id.description: The ID of the entry to update.

state.description: Provide a string that indicates the policy state.
